replies.body: Looks like you followed through with your threat to afk. Which means that you were greifing the game just as much as you accused your teammates of doing.

I think the system has made a mistake. You should have received a longer ban due to your trolling behaviors.

You spent both games flaming your team, making threats of AFK, attempting to force them to do what you're bossing them to do, and literally not a single chat line is actually useful.
LOL thats funny that you say that
Funny I say what? You say it's stupid you can get banned for this - in fact this is exactly the sort of behavior that should result in punishments. What confuses you about this?
So you say THAT I had trolly behavior when my support LITERALLY inted my game...... and you think that I should be punished for opening mid
ever heard "two wrongs don't make a right"?

Yes. Intentionally AFKing is not acceptable. Period. Full stop.

Not even to mention that you hardcore flamed, insulted, and harassed teammates for the entirety of each of these games.
The support chose to int my game so my team agreed to open and I got punished so thats cool

Open mid is not acceptable unless both your team **and** the enemy team agree. Any form of AFK, leaving, attempting to "speed up" the game **other than a surrender vote** is not acceptable.

Even still, flaming people is not acceptable behavior no matter what others in the game are doing.
I think that my support should be banned not me, idk why your defending the person that actually griefs games and instead targeting me for telling him not to and him still inting

This is not an "either or" situation. You may very well both deserve punishment.

You don't have the authority to tell people what to do. You are not the boss. You are not the team captain.

In terms of LoL's rules, it's never acceptable. The only thing that a unanimous agreement changes is that you're not likely to get reported for it, meaning no punishment.

10 game chat resteiction*
Chat restrictions work based on games not days, just to clear things up. 

Additionally, you admit that this is light flame, so why wouldn't it be punishable?

I know im answering a question with a question but do you think you should punished for light flame, the second game was mb due to cussing and i understand why I was banned based off that game but the first game is just like... I shouldnt be banned for that
This is not light flame. This is you, in two separate games, spending the entire game hardcore flaming, insulting, and harassing teammates.
in the first game i did not insult the soraka so
Calling someone an "inter" isn't an insult to you?
It is based off severity x consistency. By the sounds of it, you get CR (chat restricted) a lot. Whether that is accross multiple accounts or not is unclear.

Hey man guess what.
Kindred doesn't ALWAYS have to ult a teammate.
So stop yelling at a Kindred when they don't.
Which is dumber?  That someone can get banned for X or that someone does X knowing they can get banned for it?

"Mike PandaX: oh no my ping"

I like this line especially because from my own personal experience, people like to try and blame it on something else in the chat so it looks like they aren't actually afk or inting to the people who read those things. It's really, really scummy. 

I really wish the tribunal returned tbh. If not in the old form, then in some form where you can watch games and decide as a group whether or not things like chat match with what's actually happening. This situation was caught now but there's likely hundreds of these situations that get away completely free each day.
